title: Error reading available plugins when running as a user without a home directory
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

When running rclone as a user without a home directory, the first line reports an error trying to load plugins.
Example:
```
pi@quasar:~ $ sudo -u rclone rclone lsd --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf Dropbox:
2020/09/14 12:33:40 ERROR : error reading available plugins: Error creating : /home/rclone/.cache/rclone/webgui/plugins/config
```

In this case, "rclone" is a user without password or home directory, who will issue rclone commands using the configuration file passed on the command line (in a cron job, for example).

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.53.1
- os/arch: linux/arm
- go version: go1.15


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Raspbian


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Dropbox


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`sudo -u rclone rclone lsd --config /etc/rclone/rclone.conf Dropbox:`


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

2020/09/14 13:52:55 ERROR : error reading available plugins: Error creating : ```
/home/rclone/.cache/rclone/webgui/plugins/config
2020/09/14 13:52:55 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "lsd" "-vv" "--config" "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf" "Dropbox:"]
2020/09/14 13:52:55 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2020/09/14 13:52:55 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "Dropbox:"
[correct listing of Dropbox]
2020/09/14 13:52:56 DEBUG : 3 go routines active
```
